We both agreed we would likely further  enjoy this combo w seaweed wrapper as opposed to tortilla. Husby was still hungry so we had shrimp and veg tempura, EXCELLENTLY done, and the dipping sauce flavorful. We had a coupon from our last wheel spin for a free large sake ($5.50 value) and it was very much appreciated. We will be back.

Reviews.Author: Kade
Reviews.Content: Best sushi in Vegas. Served by Itamae Aki, everything is excellent. If you're in the 89012, this place deserves a visit. Don't miss the specialty roles listed on the wall (they are hand written in size 5 font so sit to the left at the sushi bar if you want to read).

Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: I walk in, sit down, and they already know what I want. They've never forgotten me from the past time i was here. This is customer service. Love is place.

Reviews.Author: Sanaz
Reviews.Content: Something, LoverSoul, Hurricane Rolls are delish! Also te halibut is always good here!

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Great sushi and affordable for 4. Fresh fish and the yellowtail cheek was perfect.  Great service and highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: Efficient and friendly service, excellent lunch specials, sushi was fresh and delicious. Recommend the Tarantula roll, and their California roll was best I've ever had (simple roll, excellently prepared).

Reviews.Author: Dobie
Reviews.Content: I love sushi.. I'm not a sushi snob but I know good sushi and this restaurant really know their sushi!! Did I say enough  sushi ? Lol I loved their food and staff were very friendly. I took away a star because of the cleanliness of the restaurant. I think they need to work on that.

Reviews.Author: Arthur
Reviews.Content: A solid lunch option for me because they have sushi combos and no AYCE. No AYCE means I'm not stuffed when I go back to work, but it also can be trouble for me because my lack of discipline can lead to a $40-$50 lunch. It's hard to say no when I'm eating good sushi.   I order the lunch special #3 ($7.95) which consists of miso soup, 5 pieces of nigiri, and 4 pieces of california roll. That usually isn't enough for me so I'll order a roll or two more. Keep an eye on the dry erase board which has some additional delicious items not offered on the menu. The writing is small, so you might have to get up to look. On this visit I also ordered the A Little Help from My Friend (~$12?): cucumber, cream cheese, crab, topped with seared NY strip and mustard sauce. The roll was delicious. There is also donburi and udon selections on the lunch menu.  The chefs and the server are always on top of things and I'm never stressed about getting to back to work on time. This place will always be on the radar when looking for lunch options.

Reviews.Author: Kwisatz
Reviews.Content: Service and food was very  ok   nit bad, but to pricey in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Madison
Reviews.Content: Their raw fish tasted super fresh, and was great. This place serves actual, good, authentic sushi that is made with love. No thin, obviously frozen old fish here. Delicious! I'll definitely be back next time I visit vegas.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey
Reviews.Content: Good food, but food was room temperature. I like the sushi to be very cold. Very small inside. Wonderful service , full of smiles. Good prices

Reviews.Author: Claire
Reviews.Content: There are usually three employees, the sushi chef, kitchen chef and hostess/server. For such a small operation with about six tables and eight seats at the sushi bar they do a hell of a job.

Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: Best sushi in Vegas! Came thirty mins to close and sushi was phenomenal

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Good sushi, yummy miso soup was tasty as was the seaweed salad. I had too rolls, both were brought quickly and were fresh. Cute little neighborhood joint. I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: A solid little neighborhood sushi joint. Nothing too fancy pants here, but simple stuff served from the sushi bar and from the kitchen.  Not wanting to limit ourselves to just the fish, we went with a combo that included a salad, some sushi, miso soup, tempura, and chicken karaage. We also added a roll and set forth to eat a modest dinner.  The soup arrived first. A fine bowl of miso. Then the platter with the chicken, sushi and tempura veggies. All were solid. I was a big fan of the chicken but you have to like karaage to enjoy the texture. It was served plenty hot and was definitely juicy. Tempura veggies were a light golden color and still crispy without being overdone. The extra roll came last and was generously portioned and a welcome addition to the mix.  Strip mall sushi spots are some of my faves--because they're so unassuming you can often have your expectations met. Such was the case for me. Simple dinner, then back to the hotel. Easy peasy.

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I really really really really like this place.  It is tiny - 4 tables and 8 sushi bar spots.    The Sushi chef is Japanese.  It seems to be a family run place.  Excellent service - a convivial establishment.  They had a buy a Saporo and get a free sake deal - you can't argue with that!  We had monkey brain appetizer, firecracker roll, spicey tuna and a tiger eye.  The tiger eye is tuna and avocado wrapped in squid - it was expertly prepared.  It doesn't have a sushi restaurant feel though - it looks more like a sandwich spot - but that is only a side note.  The prices were reasonable.  This really is a nice little neighborhood spot with quality food and a friendly atmosphere.  I will go back when I am the green valley area.

Reviews.Author: Kalei
Reviews.Content: I've been to this restaurant several times and have always been treated nicely. The food is good especially the creamy mermaid (appetizer). They're very fast in seating you and the food comes out pretty quickly. The hello kitty roll like others have said is really yummy. If you go during the lunch hour, the prices are really good for bento boxes. It's great for dates but, it's quite small for a group of more than four. The restaurant is very clean as well. Children can eat here too because they have meals that cater to them. I have nothing really bad to say about this place because overall it's a good restaurant. I'll be returning.

Reviews.Author: Julia
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I tried to eat here but it smelled like they had a plumbing issue so we left.

Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: I live right down the street from this place, and I used to work in this plaza, so I have seen many places come and go in this spot in those years. I was really excited, however, when I saw that we would be getting a new sushi place so close to home, and I have to say, I hope that this place sticks around.   My husband and I actually went the evening they opened and we weren't disappointed. Everyone was so friendly, and the food was delicious.  We've gone back several times, both to dine in and take out, and the service is always excellent regardless. Even when waiting for our take out orders, we are offered free tea or water.   The prices are reasonable very reasonable for what you get, and I would definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Reviews were right on this one! I had some miso soup (amazing), a tiger roll and a rock n roll. Both rolls were awesome and I've never tasted anything like it! I will definitely visit this spot again when I come back!

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite place to go!  Aki, Chako, and their teen aged kids are so friendly and the sushi is the best. It's fresh, delicious, creative, and so beautifully presented. Aki is a Beatles fan so if you are, you have much in common. Do sit at the bar and enjoy.
